title: About
text: Hi, my name is Jenn Deng. Iâ€™m currently a senior studying Health and Societies with a minor in Data Science & Analytics. Explore LLMs with me! A bunch of topics all over the place! Get to know me through what I post about.

title: Posting Pictures for ChatGPT
text:
Posting Pictures for ChatGPT

In this blog post, I will be uploading pictures to ChatGPT.
This experiment is to see whether ChatGPT can accurately describe the scene.



Picture of a Switzerland Keychain


Jenn: â€œCan you describe what this photo is to me? And what this object is?â€



ChatGPT: This photo shows a person wearing black gloves holding a keychain. The keychain is heart-shaped and made of wood, featuring an illustration of Interlaken, Switzerland. It has the Swiss flag on it, along with mountains and buildings, likely representing the scenic landscape of the town. The keychain is attached to a metal ring for keys.The packaging label at the top is red, displaying the brand name Alberto SA. It has a barcode and a price tag indicating Fr.Â 8.â€“ (Swiss Francs). The background suggests a store setting, possibly a souvenir shop, with other keychains and items on display.


Jennâ€™s Observations: I think ChatGPT was able to accurately describe the picture!


2. Picture of â€˜Babelâ€™ at Tate Modern in London

Jenn: â€œCan you tell me who made this, what it is, where itâ€™s located, and why it was created?â€



ChatGPT: Yes! This is a well-known art installation called Babel by the artist Cildo Meireles. What is it?: Babel is a towering installation made from hundreds of stacked radios from different time periods and styles. The radios are arranged in a cylindrical structure, with some turned on and emitting faint sounds, creating a layered auditory experience. Where is it located?: It is part of the collection at the Tate Modern in London, though it may be exhibited elsewhere in temporary installations. Why was it created?: Cildo Meireles created Babel as a commentary on communication, information overload, and miscommunication in the modern world. The name refers to the Biblical Tower of Babel, a story in which human ambition to reach the heavens led to the confusion of languages, causing people to be unable to understand each other. Similarly, the installation suggests the overwhelming and often chaotic nature of mass communication today. If you saw this in a different museum, it could be on loan or part of a traveling exhibition!


Jennâ€™s Observations: Itâ€™s interesting how ChatGPT was still able to detect that it was Babel, even though there was a person who was in the way of the art piece. I liked how it mentions that if I saw it at a different museum that it was probably apart of a traveling exhibition.



3. Picture of one side of the Sagrada Familia

Jenn: â€œWhat is this, where is this, who created it, and why was it created?â€



ChatGPT: This is a photo of the interior of the Sagrada FamÃ­lia, a world-famous basilica located in Barcelona, Spain. What is this? The image captures the breathtaking stained glass windows and organic, tree-like columns inside the Sagrada FamÃ­lia. The interplay of natural light and vibrant colors is a hallmark of this architectural masterpiece. Who created it? The Sagrada FamÃ­lia was designed by the renowned Catalan architect Antoni GaudÃ­. Construction began in 1882, and it remains unfinished to this day, with ongoing work continuing in accordance with GaudÃ­â€™s vision. Why was it created? GaudÃ­ envisioned the Sagrada FamÃ­lia as a deeply spiritual and symbolic structure, blending Gothic and Art Nouveau styles with naturalistic forms. The basilica was created as a place of worship and devotion, meant to inspire awe and reflect Christian faith through architecture. The organic, tree-like columns, geometric details, and stained glass windows were all meticulously designed to create a harmonious and immersive experience. It is one of the most visited landmarks in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, drawing millions of visitors annually. The goal is to complete its construction by 2032, marking the 150th anniversary of GaudÃ­â€™s death.


Jennâ€™s Observations: Even though I only showed a small portion, ChatGPT was still able to guess the location accurately. I am impressed.




Conclusions

Overall, I was genuinely impressed by how accurately ChatGPT identified the objects and locations in my photos. One moment that really stood out to me was how descriptive it was when analyzing a simple keychain. It picked up on nearly every detail in the image and seemed to base its interpretation on everything available in the scene. With the photo of Babel at the Tate Modern in London, I was surprised by how thoroughly it described the artwork itself, even though there were distractions in the image, like a blurry person in the foreground. Despite such visual noise, ChatGPT stayed focused on the central subject and provided an insightful summary. I also appreciated how much it was able to say about the Sagrada Familia, even though I only included a small snippet of the structure in the frame. It still recognized key architectural features and offered meaningful commentary. These moments made me realize just how sophisticated the image interpretation capabilities have become and they made me want to push the boundaries even more. Perhaps next time, Iâ€™ll experiment with uploading some truly questionable hand-drawn sketches to see how well it can decipher abstract or less defined visuals!

title: Movie Suggestions?: Testing Out Google Prompt Engineering Guide
text:
Google claims that prompt enginnering can help you be more productive. It also says that using natural language to command a large language model could help propel a lot of the workflow on teams.
Googleâ€™s Tips to Becoming a World-Class Prompt Engineeer

title: Movie Suggestions?: Testing Out Google Prompt Engineering Guide
section: Letâ€™s try a few of these techniques to see which works the best for me
text:
Letâ€™s try a few of these techniques to see which works the best for me

Direct Prompt




I like how it doesnâ€™t really question me further, but provides random movies across all genres. I like how it asks, â€œWant seomthing thoughtfulâ€ or â€œIn the mood for comedyâ€ as a way to engage my interests in certain types of movies. However, as a person whoâ€™s really indecisive, I want to hone in my search. Letâ€™s go into other prompting techniques.


One, few, and multi-shot prompts




This one got more specific, which helped me because it specified horror movies that are similar to Hereditary. For example, the list already has movies that Iâ€™ve watched, and I can confirm that it is very similar to the example movie.


Chain of Thought Prompting




Honestly, even with more specific prompting, it recommended me the same movies as the previous ones. There were a few more suggestions, but still. But at the end, it asks would you prefer one that leans more towards supernatural horror, psychological breakdown, or cult/paranormal themes. Perhaps if I answered that, I could have more unique responses.

title: Playing Around with Gemini 2.0
text:
Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental !!!
The class recently got an announcement about Googleâ€™s latest multi-modal text to image model, Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental.  The model can edit images on the gly without generating them entirely new, which is crazy.  Around the same time, I also stumbled upon a Tik Tok video by @hes_a_nerd.

At first, he explains how this photo looks like a normal photo taken with a group of peopleâ€¦ but itâ€™s actually ChatGPT 4.0s latest ability with photos. It can now generate photos with direct prompting and itâ€™s way better than DALLE.  Hereâ€™s their statement about this new update:  > At OpenAI, we have long believed image generation should be a primary capability of our language models. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve built our most advanced image generator yet into GPTâ€‘4o. The resultâ€”image generation that is not only beautiful, but useful.
You might wonder, how did someone create this image. Hereâ€™s what they typed in.
prompt: Create an image that looks like it was taken from an iPhone 6, a group of college aged kids, 3 or 4 smiling while outside. It is dusk, and they are on a city campus. It should be noisy and look authentic not cinematic, this photo was lazily taken in the November cold.
Thereâ€™s nothing that stands out about it that looks like itâ€™s from AI. It can generate text the most flawlessly, and it can create text on the boards. Thereâ€™s even a reflection and the details are insane. You can edit with one sentence. Thatâ€™s crazy. Take a look.

You can tell that in the prompt, they create specific text to have in the imaging. This is a next level, new update. Itâ€™s scary.  The improved capabilities are made to train models on the joint distribution of online images and text, learning not just how images relate to language, but how they relate to each other. Itâ€™s combined with aggressive post-training and is able to produce visual fluency, capable of generating images that are useful, consistent, and context-aware.  Text rendering is possible. 4oâ€™s ability to blend precise symbls with imagery turns image generation into a tool for visual communication.
For this blog post, I want to experiment with Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental. Letâ€™s see if I can replicate these images above and prompt it to create realistic photos.

Letâ€™s Create the College Group Photo

Woah, Iâ€™ve never used this before. I like how they have examples of what you can ask it to do. But Iâ€™m going to stick to entering the prompt for the photo. Letâ€™s see if it generates something similar to ChatGPTâ€™s model.

Ermâ€¦. why is this not working.

Ok, maybe the prompt was too complicated. Iâ€™ll justâ€¦ simplify it and ask: 
prompt: Can you create a photo of college kids on their campus.
The output is this: 
{
  "prompt": "A photorealistic image of a diverse group of four college students (early 20s, mixed gender and ethnicity) sitting together casually on a sunny green lawn (quad) on a university campus. They are dressed in casual clothes like jeans, t-shirts, and hoodies, with backpacks resting beside them on the grass. One student is smiling while looking at a laptop open on their lap, while the others are engaged in relaxed conversation, looking at each other or the laptop screen. In the background, classic brick university buildings with large windows and mature trees are visible under a clear blue sky with soft sunlight. The atmosphere is bright, relaxed, and friendly. Medium shot, natural lighting.",
  "negative_prompt": "blurry, unfocused, poorly lit, distorted faces, unnatural poses, empty campus, children, high school students, business attire, overly staged",
  "style_raw": "photorealistic",
  "aspect_ratio": "16:9"
}
What I did with this output was I inputted into ChatGPT 4o. This is what it gave me.

This isnâ€™t as realistic as the original. I wonder why.
Thereâ€™s a toggle where I can click Geminiâ€™s Thoughts, so hereâ€™s what it explains. It explains the thinking process that could lead to the image and description that I provided: 
Understand the Request: The user wants a photo of "college kids on their campus." This is a fairly broad request, so I need to make some assumptions or choose a common, relatable scenario.

Identify Key Elements:

Subject: College students ("kids" implies younger, undergraduate age, probably diverse).

Setting: A college campus. This needs typical campus elements.

Action/Mood: What are they doing? How do they feel? Needs to look natural and characteristic of college life.

Brainstorm Campus Scenarios:

Walking between classes.

Sitting on a quad/lawn, studying or relaxing.

Gathered near a prominent building (library, student union, academic hall).

Interacting in a group.

Carrying backpacks, books, laptops.

Laughing, talking, focused.

Choose a Specific Scenario: Sitting on the grass on a sunny day seems like a classic, positive, and visually appealing campus scene. It allows for group interaction and showcases the campus environment. Let's go with a small group relaxing and maybe chatting or looking at something together (like a laptop or phone).

Flesh out the Details for the Image Generation:

Number of students: A small group, maybe 3-5, feels natural for a casual gathering.

Diversity: Aim for a mix of genders and ethnicities to represent a typical modern campus.

Appearance: Casual college attire â€“ jeans, t-shirts, hoodies, sneakers. Backpacks nearby. Maybe one has a laptop or notebook out.

Setting Details: Green grass (a quad or lawn). Some recognizable campus architecture in the background â€“ perhaps brick buildings, trees, pathways. Maybe hints of other students further away to add life.

Lighting/Atmosphere: Bright, sunny day. Warm, relaxed, friendly atmosphere. Natural lighting.

Composition: Medium shot, showing the students and some of the surrounding campus. Eye-level perspective.

Formulate the Prompt for the AI Image Generator: Based on the above details, construct a prompt. It needs to be descriptive.

Initial thought: "College students on campus lawn." (Too simple)

Adding detail: "Photo of a diverse group of 4 college students (2 male, 2 female) sitting casually on a sunny green lawn on their university campus."

Adding action/mood: "Photo of a diverse group of 4 college students (early 20s) laughing and talking together, sitting casually on a sunny green quad lawn on their university campus."

Adding background/atmosphere: "Photorealistic image of a diverse group of 4 college students (early 20s, mixed gender/ethnicity) sitting together casually on a bright, sunny green lawn (quad) on a university campus. They are dressed in casual clothes (jeans, t-shirts, hoodies) and have backpacks nearby. One might be looking at a laptop. In the background, classic brick university buildings and trees are visible under a clear blue sky. Warm, relaxed, friendly atmosphere. Natural lighting." (This is getting good and detailed).

Refining for style: "Photorealistic style, natural lighting, medium shot."

Generate the Image: Use the refined prompt with the AI image generator.

Review the Output: Look at the generated image. Does it match the request and the intended details?

Are they college-aged? Yes.

Is it a campus setting? Yes, lawn, buildings.

Is the group diverse? Yes.

Is the mood right? Yes, looks relaxed/interactive.

Is the quality good? Yes, photorealistic.

Write the Description: Describe the generated image for the user, highlighting the key elements and confirming it meets their request.

Start by stating what the image shows.

Describe the subjects (students, their appearance, actions).

Describe the setting (lawn, buildings, weather).

Mention the overall mood/atmosphere.

Offer to generate variations if needed.

Final Check: Read the request, the generated image, and the description together. Does it all align? Yes.
Well. Letâ€™s see if it can edit current photos. Iâ€™ll use the college campus one that it generated, and Iâ€™ll add a few things here and there.


Attempting to Generate Words in A Photo
Letâ€™s see if Gemini is able to create readable words in an image. 
Create an image of someone taking a picture of a person writing on a white board. On the white board, the title is "transfer between modalities" on the top left. Under this text, have this sentence "Suppose we directly model. Under this text, have a pros and cons. To the right, have a paragraph that says "Fixes: * model compressed representations *compose autoregressive prior with a powerful decoder.
Hereâ€™s the output: 
{
  "prompt": "Photorealistic image capturing a scene from slightly behind a person holding a smartphone horizontally, taking a picture. The main focus is another person (e.g., a researcher or student) standing in front of a large, brightly lit whiteboard in a modern office or classroom setting. The person at the whiteboard is holding a black marker, perhaps pointing towards the text. The whiteboard clearly displays the following handwritten text:\n\nTop left corner: Title 'Transfer Between Modalities'\nDirectly below the title: Sentence 'Suppose we directly model.'\nBelow that sentence, a section structured for 'Pros:' and 'Cons:' (perhaps with a few placeholder bullet points or lines under each label).\nPositioned to the right of the 'Pros and Cons' section: A paragraph titled 'Fixes:' followed by two distinct bullet points (using asterisks):\n'* model compressed representations'\n'* compose autoregressive prior with a powerful decoder'\n\nThe lighting is bright and naturalistic, typical of an indoor office environment. The focus should be sharp on the whiteboard content and the person writing/presenting. The photographer's hands and phone are partially visible in the foreground framing the shot. Minimal background clutter.",
  "negative_prompt": "blurry text, illegible writing, misspelled words, incorrect text layout, distorted hands, multiple people writing, chalkboard, dark room, messy handwriting, cartoon, illustration, drawing, sketch, cluttered background, empty whiteboard",
  "style_raw": "photorealistic",
  "aspect_ratio": "16:9"
}

Well, this looks nothing like the example that was given above. It was able to create some words, but thereâ€™s still some slight mistakes with the words in the photo. The photo also doesnâ€™t look realistic, which is also a big con.


Modifying Images
Another tool Gemini can be used for is creating edits of images. A friend of mine a few days ago posted â€œStudio Ghibliâ€ versions of his photos. Hereâ€™s an example of what Studio Ghibli art is like: 




A Lovely Image





Another Lovely Image





The Last Lovely Image



I wonder if this will be possible using Gemini. Letâ€™s try it out.
{
  "prompt": "A group of five diverse college students (mixed gender and ethnicity, resembling the original photo's subjects) sitting together casually on a lush green lawn on a university campus quad, rendered in the iconic Studio Ghibli anime style. They are dressed in simple, casual clothes (jeans, t-shirts, sweaters). Backpacks, a slightly stylized laptop, and books rest beside them on the grass. They have expressive, kind faces with characteristic Ghibli eyes, smiling and engaged in relaxed conversation. In the background, charming, slightly weathered brick university buildings with large windows and hints of ivy are depicted with soft, painterly detail. The scene is bathed in warm, gentle sunlight under a vibrant blue sky with fluffy, hand-painted Ghibli clouds. The overall atmosphere is peaceful, nostalgic, and heartwarming. Hand-drawn aesthetic, vibrant but soft color palette, medium shot.",
  "negative_prompt": "photorealistic, 3D render, CGI, photo, photograph, realistic proportions, overly detailed textures, modern anime style, harsh lines, dark, gloomy, watermark, text, signature, blurry, unfocused",
  "style_raw": "Studio Ghibli anime style",
  "aspect_ratio": "16:9"
}



Original
Edited Version









This was successful!  Gemini was able to edit photos correctly. 



Conclusion
Although Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental didnâ€™t create the most realistic photos, nor did it do the best with text in an image, it did a create job of editing the style of the photo when I asked it to create a â€œStudio Ghibliâ€ version.  Perhaps there was something wrong with my versions, because it only provided the prompt for the images and I had to enter it into ChatGPT 4o to create the images.  I really liked the thoughts section of Gemini, it breaks down how it interpretted my prompting and was able to explain most of how it created these images.  All in all, I would use Gemini to modify the style of pictures in the future. I wouldnâ€™t use it for text, but itâ€™s great for a more creative use.

title: Popular at UPenn: Letâ€™s Test the Range of ChatGPT Tools!
text:
Today as I was thinking about what I should experiment with for my 10th blog post (yay!), I decided to explore my UPenn ChatGPT account that was granted to me by my statistics class. title: Dean, Jess, or Logan: Writing a Persuasive Paper with Deep Research
text:

Logan also ends up inspiring Rory in her career indirectly. In Season 7, when Logan ventures into starting his own business, Rory watches him navigate failure and persistence â€“ that, coupled with his constant belief in her talent, likely reinforced her own resilience. By the revival, itâ€™s implied that Logan still inspires some of Roryâ€™s big life decisions (for better or worse), showing how their connection continues to influence her. On the negative side, some argue that being with Logan indulged Roryâ€™s worst tendencies. During the period she was dating Logan and estranged from her mother, Rory fell into a spoiled lifestyle â€“ joining the DAR, lounging in pool houses â€“ essentially living like the Huntzberger heir apparent and losing touch with her old drive. Critics have noted that around Logan, Rory sometimes became â€œinsufferable and entitled,â€ soaking in his privilegeâ€‹ pajiba.com . Itâ€™s fair to say that Loganâ€™s decadent world (limos, expensive gifts, elite clubs) was a double-edged sword for Roryâ€™s development. It gave her amazing opportunities and fun, but also risked making her complacent. Fortunately, Rory self-corrects by returning to Yale and resuming her journalism path, and Logan supports her in that. Another point: Logan didnâ€™t challenge Rory academically the way Jess did; he met her on her level, which was great, but he wasnâ€™t pushing her to excel in school or career â€“ he assumed sheâ€™d do fine. The one time Rory seriously faltered (after Mitchumâ€™s critique), Logan disagreed with her quitting Yale but ultimately let her make her choice without aggressively intervening. Unlike Jess (who bluntly demanded Rory go back to Yale), Logan took a gentler approach, perhaps too gentle. He worried about her but didnâ€™t try to force her hand. Some fans interpret this as Logan not pushing Rory to be her best in that momentâ€‹ warhawknews.com . Overall though, Logan helped Rory grow by broadening her horizons. Through him, she experienced love in an adult context â€“ complete with navigating family disapproval, managing long-distance when heâ€™s in London, and contemplating real future plans. She learned compromise and forgiveness (working through their breakup and reconciling made her more emotionally mature). By being with Logan, Rory also got a taste of the high-profile life she once thought she wanted (affluence and all), and by the end she realizes the importance of forging her own path (e.g.Â she turns down his proposal to focus on her career). One could argue that Loganâ€™s greatest influence on Roryâ€™s growth was teaching her what she does and doesnâ€™t want in life. He encouraged her to seize the day, but also inadvertently helped her see that she wasnâ€™t ready to settle down and become â€œMrs.Â Huntzbergerâ€ under someone elseâ€™s terms. In that sense, he influenced her to assert her independence. And unlike with Dean or Jess, Rory with Logan grew into a more assertive, self-assured woman who could hold her own in any room. Compatibility (Values, Goals, Communication): Rory and Logan were highly compatible once both adjusted to the relationship. They shared similar intellectual backgrounds and could match each otherâ€™s wit in conversation. Loganâ€™s quick banter and Roryâ€™s clever comebacks made them an evenly matched pair in communication. They also developed a genuine friendship at the core of their romanceâ€‹ archive.thetab.com â€“ often laughing together, exchanging ideas, and providing counsel to one another. In terms of values, there were initial differences: Rory was humble and grounded, while Logan was more carefree and used to excess. Yet, Loganâ€™s influence made Rory a bit more adventurous, and Roryâ€™s influence grounded Logan. Over time, their values converged toward a middle ground of responsibility and spontaneity. Both valued family, though from different angles (Rory cherishes her relationship with Lorelai; Logan has a complicated but present family life). Importantly, both Rory and Logan value ambition and career, and this is a big compatibility point. Rory is driven to be a journalist; Logan, despite his trust-fund kid faÃ§ade, is driven to prove himself outside his fatherâ€™s shadow. They respect each otherâ€™s work and aspirations. In Season 7, when Logan starts a new business, Rory is supportive and proud; when Rory gets a big job offer, Logan encourages her even if it means being apart. They understand the importance of each otherâ€™s goals. The only real conflict in goals comes at the very end: Logan envisions an engaged/married future that would likely involve Rory moving to California or into his world, whereas Rory isnâ€™t ready to sacrifice her independence. That crossroads highlights a slight incompatibility in timing/goals at graduation. But aside from that, their life plans meshed well as young adults. Communication between Rory and Logan was generally strong, once Logan committed. They are shown having frank discussions about their relationship rules (e.g.Â when Rory decides she canâ€™t do casual anymore, she clearly communicates it, and Logan responds by committing to her)â€‹ brit.co â€‹ brit.co . They survive arguments without breaking up; they talk things through. A great example is how they handle Loganâ€™s business failure â€“ Rory comforts him and helps him regroup, showing how well they communicate in hardship. Even their one major conflict (the â€œbreakâ€ incident) is resolved through honest dialogue and apology, rather than an irreparable blow-up. By contrast, Roryâ€™s conflicts with Jess almost always ended in someone storming off. With Logan, Rory can argue and resolve. One review pointed out that Logan and Rory â€œcan resolve arguments without a dramatic breakup,â€ highlighting a level of communication maturity unique to that pairingâ€‹ archive.thetab.com . Culturally and socially, Rory and Logan also fit well. She could navigate his elite circles when needed (she impressed people at his sisterâ€™s wedding and other events), and he could hang in her world (dinners with her family, town events) without major friction â€“ apart from Emily and Richardâ€™s initial scheming, which was external. In summary, Rory and Logan were highly compatible in outlook and stage of life. They were partners who encouraged each otherâ€™s dreams and tackled challenges together. Amy Sherman-Palladino did design Logan to be a bit of a mirror to Roryâ€™s father (Christopher) â€“ â€œLogan was Christopherâ€¦ charming, smart, and not quite the dependable soulâ€ at firstâ€‹ ew.com â€“ but unlike Lorelai and Christopher, Rory and Logan grew into a dependable team. By the end of the series, many would say Rory and Logan had the makings of a long-term match, if Rory had been ready for that step. Chemistry and Screen Presence: On screen, Rory and Loganâ€™s relationship exuded sparkling charm and fun. Their early scenes are flirtatious and fizzy â€“ like their first meeting where Logan good-naturedly mocks Roryâ€™s attendance at a dumb Yale party, or their coffee cart banter about journalists. Once together, they have a playful intimacy; for example, their pillow talk scenes and exchanges of the nickname â€œAceâ€ are filled with warmth. Alexis Bledel and Matt Czuchry had a natural ease together that sold the progression from flirtation to deep love. During dramatic moments (like Roryâ€™s tearful confrontation when she finds out about the bridesmaids), their chemistry also carries the weight â€“ you can feel Roryâ€™s hurt and Loganâ€™s remorse intensely. Unlike Jessâ€™s fiery tension or Deanâ€™s gentle affection, Rory and Loganâ€™s chemistry often manifests as bright, lively energy and mature sexual tension. They look like a young couple truly in love, comfortable being themselves around each other. Critics have noted that Logan brought Rory out of her shell, and you can see that in their scenes â€“ Rory is more vivacious and adventurous with Logan by her sideâ€‹ archive.thetab.com . Thereâ€™s also a strong element of friendship in their chemistry; viewers can believe these two enjoy each otherâ€™s company deeply, laughing and confiding in one another. When Logan proposes, the emotional chemistry is palpable â€“ it feels like a huge moment for both, underscoring how far theyâ€™ve come. While some fans feel Rory and Loganâ€™s dynamic wasnâ€™t as â€œpassionateâ€ as Rory/Jess, many others saw it as a more adult, realistic chemistry that still had plenty of romance. They were a glittering college power couple with inside jokes and heartfelt moments, and that translated into engaging television. Not to mention, scenes like the elaborate Life and Death Brigade stunt (with Logan charmingly coaxing a nervous Rory) had a grand, cinematic quality that made their pairing stand out in the showâ€™s later seasons. Fan and Critical Reception: Logan is arguably the most polarizing of Roryâ€™s boyfriends. During the showâ€™s run, he had staunch supporters and just as staunch detractors. Early on, some fans dismissed him as a shallow rich kid and resented him for (seemingly) undermining Roryâ€™s path when she dropped out of Yale. However, as Loganâ€™s character developed, many viewers warmed up to him â€“ especially seeing how much he grew for Roryâ€™s sake. By the series finale, a large segment of the fandom had become â€œTeam Logan,â€ impressed by how he committed to Rory and treated her well. Still, â€œTeam Jessâ€ loyalists often argue that Logan, while a great boyfriend in practice, didnâ€™t inspire Rory intellectually the way Jess did. The fanbase remains split to this day, which was evident when the 2016 revival reignited debates (with Logan reappearing in Roryâ€™s life in a complicated way). Critically, Loganâ€™s relationship with Rory has received a lot of positive reevaluation. In retrospective rankings and articles, Logan is frequently cited as Roryâ€™s best match by the end of the seriesâ€‹ archive.thetab.com â€‹ archive.thetab.com . For example, The Tab declared, â€œLogan is the best match for Rory by the end of the show,â€ emphasizing how he adored her, was her intellectual equal, and truly loved herâ€‹ archive.thetab.com â€‹ archive.thetab.com . That piece and others acknowledge Loganâ€™s faults but conclude that no one else fit Roryâ€™s adult life as well as he didâ€‹ archive.thetab.com . Professional TV critics have noted that Logan challenged Rory in ways that were ultimately healthy â€“ giving her a partner who could banter at her level and a taste of big opportunities. On the flip side, some critics (and even Amy Sherman-Palladino herself) point out that Roryâ€™s fling with Logan had elements of â€œfather issueâ€ psychology â€“ essentially, that Logan was a stand-in for her father (charming but unpredictable)â€‹ vanityfair.com â€‹ ew.com . This was a deliberate writing choice, but it suggests that Logan might not be the stable choice for a long-term partner. Nonetheless, by Season 7 Logan had outgrown a lot of his Christopher-like flakiness. Fan discussions today often cite Loganâ€™s character development: he evolved from careless playboy to responsible, loving partner â€“ which is a journey many appreciate. His grand romantic gestures (the coffee cart â€œrocketâ€ gift as a token of commitment, flying in to surprise Rory, etc.) and the fact that â€œhe always cared for Rory and was there for herâ€â€‹ oakparktalon.org have earned him lots of love. In polls conducted by entertainment sites in recent years, Logan often wins or comes a close second to Jess as the preferred Rory match, whereas Dean trails far behind. Even a licensed therapist chimed in via Elite Daily, agreeing that Logan was Roryâ€™s healthiest partner due to their secure attachment and mutual esteemâ€‹ brit.co . Of course, there are still fans who canâ€™t forgive Logan for his mistakes or who simply find Jess and Roryâ€™s connection more compelling. Amy Sherman-Palladino, when asked to pick a team, diplomatically chose â€œTeam Roryâ€ â€“ but Daniel Palladino admitted they have a soft spot for all three boysâ€‹ eonline.com â€‹ eonline.com . Itâ€™s telling that the show left Rory single at the end; it acknowledged the debate might never be settled. In the end, Loganâ€™s reception has improved over time, and many now view him as the man who was almost the one for Rory â€“ if only timing and her readiness had aligned (and, as the revival teased, perhaps their story isnâ€™t completely over). For this evaluation, itâ€™s fair to say Logan enjoys a reputation as Roryâ€™s most serious and arguably most well-matched boyfriend, particularly in the eyes of critics reexamining the seriesâ€‹ archive.thetab.com , even as fan opinions remain divided. Comparative Summary Table To crystallize the analysis, hereâ€™s a summary comparison of Dean, Jess, and Logan across the main dimensions:
Criteria Dean (First Love) Jess (Intellectual Rebel) Logan (College Sweetheart) Emotional Support & Treatment Devoted & caring in the beginning â€“ made Rory feel safe and adored. However, became jealous and insecure as Rory grew, leading to controlling behavior (e.g.Â public breakup at dance). Ultimately hurt Rory by cheating (showing emotional immaturity). Inconsistent support during dating â€“ loving but often aloof. He hurt Rory by withdrawing and leaving without word. Later, as he matured, he became supportive (e.g.Â encouraging her to fix her life), but this was after their romance. Supportive and trusting once committed â€“ stood by Rory during crises and celebrated her achievements. Had one major lapse (misunderstanding their â€œbreakâ€ and sleeping with others), but took responsibility and rebuilt trust. Treated Rory as an equal partner throughout their serious relationship. Impact on Roryâ€™s Growth Gave Rory a safe first love experience and helped her learn to navigate romance. But did not push her academically or socially; if anything, Rory outgrew him as she pursued bigger ambitions. Their breakup reinforced her drive to follow her own path. Challenged Rory significantly. Sparked her intellectual and emotional growth (first taste of rebellion and passion). His return in Season 6 was pivotal â€“ inspiring her to return to Yale and find her direction. Rory learned hard lessons (communication, independence) through Jess, fueling her personal development. Broadened Roryâ€™s horizons. Introduced adventure and risk-taking (Life and Death Brigade), helping her become bolder and more confident. Also taught her about forgiveness and compromise in an adult relationship. By proposing, he pushed her to clarify her priorities â€“ ultimately reinforcing her commitment to career and self. Values, Goals & Communication Shared small-town values of honesty and family; communicated openly in early relationship (he expressed feelings clearly). However, long-term goals diverged â€“ Dean sought a simple, settled life while Rory aimed for Yale and a big career, creating an incompatibility. Communication suffered once Roryâ€™s world expanded (he couldnâ€™t relate). Intellectual values aligned (love of books, etc.), but clashed in responsibility and attitude as teens. Poor communication in romance (Jess avoided talking about feelings/problems). In later years, their values/goals aligned better (both creative, independent spirits) and communication greatly improved, suggesting high compatibility if timing were right. Similar life stage and goals. Both value achievement (Rory in journalism, Logan in business) and have affluent family backgrounds (though Roryâ€™s was more humble in practice). Developed strong communication â€“ addressed issues honestly and worked through conflicts without imploding. A slight values clash early on (Roryâ€™s humility vs.Â Loganâ€™s extravagance) was smoothed out as they grew together. Chemistry & Screen Presence Sweet, gentle chemistry. Believable as first love â€“ tender and caring, if a bit low-key. Lacked the â€œfireâ€ of Roryâ€™s later pairings; by series end their scenes felt flat as the romance waned. Still, they had a cozy, wholesome on-screen dynamic that established Roryâ€™s romantic baseline. Intense, passionate chemistry. Rory and Jessâ€™s scenes crackled with romantic tension and rapid-fire banter. They brought out intense emotions in each other (both good and bad), making their relationship highly engaging to watch. Many fans view their on-screen connection as the most electric of the three. Playful, dynamic chemistry. Rory and Logan had a fun, flirtatious energy that evolved into a warm, deeply affectionate rapport. They truly enjoyed each otherâ€™s company, creating a balance of romance and friendship. Their on-screen interactions showed Rory at her most lively and confident, highlighting a mature but still exciting chemistry. Fan & Critical Reception Mixed to negative over time. Fondly remembered for early romance, but many fans rank him lowest due to his later possessiveness and the cheating saga. Critics often see him as a necessary first chapter for Rory, but not her best match. Some modern viewers appreciate his stability in hindsight, but â€œTeam Deanâ€ is relatively small. Beloved by a large fanbase (â€œTeam Jessâ€). Fans praise him as Roryâ€™s equal and point to his growth â€“ heâ€™s often considered the one who could have been the best match if Rory met him later. Critics acknowledge his strong chemistry and positive influence on Roryâ€™s ambitions, but note he was a poor boyfriend in practice during high school. Generally seen as a top contender for Roryâ€™s best match, despite early flaws. Initially divisive, now often seen as Roryâ€™s best partner by seriesâ€™ end. Many fans cheer â€œTeam Loganâ€ for his character development and the healthy aspects of their relationship, though some still prefer Jessâ€™s dynamic with Rory. Critics in retrospectives frequently conclude Logan was the most fitting long-term, citing his supportiveness and compatibilityâ€‹ archive.thetab.com . Nevertheless, debate persists, with a contingent viewing him as too privileged or recalling his early missteps. Conclusion: Who Was Roryâ€™s Best Match? All three of Roryâ€™s major relationships were formative, each serving a different purpose in her life. Dean was the steady first love who nurtured Roryâ€™s heart but ultimately couldnâ€™t grow with her. Jess was the intellectual soulmate who arrived at the wrong time â€“ he challenged and inspired Rory immensely, yet his own youth and issues prevented him from being a stable partner then. Logan was the equal companion of Roryâ€™s college years, who complemented her personality and ambitions, albeit with some hurdles along the way. If we weigh all the factors â€“ emotional support, personal growth, compatibility, chemistry, and overall reception â€“ Logan Huntzberger arguably emerges as the best overall match for Rory by the end of the series. By the culmination of Gilmore Girls, Rory and Logan had built the healthiest partnership: they communicated well, had fun together, weathered conflicts, and truly loved each other. Reliable commentary echoes this view, noting that â€œLogan is the best match for Rory by the end of the showâ€ and that their personalities and goals ultimately meshed the bestâ€‹ archive.thetab.com â€‹ archive.thetab.com . Logan helped Rory come into her own as an adult, and in turn, Rory inspired Logan to mature. In practical terms, he was ready to be her life partner â€“ shown by his willingness to sacrifice his playboy ways and even propose marriageâ€‹ brit.co â€‹ brit.co . That said, naming Logan as the â€œbest matchâ€ doesnâ€™t dismiss what Jess and Dean contributed. In fact, one could argue Jessâ€™s influence on Roryâ€™s personal growth was the most profound of the three â€“ heâ€™s the one who jolted her back to pursuing her dreamsâ€‹ gilmoregirls.fandom.com . Itâ€™s telling that even years later, Jess still cares for Roryâ€™s path, and Rory still trusts his guidance. Many fans maintain that Jess in a later, more mature incarnation could be Roryâ€™s ideal partner, and the door was left open for that possibility in the revival (we see Jess looking pensively at Rory, hinting his feelings linger). Dean, while not suited for Rory in the long run, gave her an example of unconditional love and respect that set her standards moving forwardâ€‹ theeverygirl.com . Even as Rory tells Dean in the revival, he showed her what it means to feel safe and cherished â€“ a foundational lesson for any future relationship. The debate over Roryâ€™s boyfriends is, as Vanity Fair put it, â€œpassionate and unresolvedâ€â€‹ vanityfair.com . Each relationship had unique strengths: Deanâ€™s unwavering devotion, Jessâ€™s deep understanding, and Loganâ€™s empowering partnership. Showrunner Amy Sherman-Palladino ultimately avoids picking a side, declaring herself â€œTeam Roryâ€ â€“ implying that Roryâ€™s choices and growth matter more than any particular guyâ€‹ eonline.com . Indeed, Roryâ€™s journey was about discovering herself; each boyfriend was a mirror reflecting different facets of Rory at different times. In conclusion, Logan appears to be the best overall match for the Rory we leave at the end of the series, given the balance of emotional support, growth, compatibility, and love in their relationship. He is the one who met Rory as an equal and was ready to build a future with herâ€‹ archive.thetab.com â€‹ archive.thetab.com . However, itâ€™s a testament to the showâ€™s rich writing that reasonable minds can differ â€“ many will forever believe â€œTeam Jessâ€ or even â€œTeam Deanâ€ should wear the crown. Whatâ€™s clear is that Rory Gilmore needed all three relationships to become the person she is: Dean, Jess, and Logan each helped Rory grow in different ways, and each romance left a lasting imprint on her heart. As fans, we were simply lucky to watch Rory experience all three epic loves â€“ and the debate over which man was truly her perfect match is a delightful part of the Gilmore Girls legacy.

What This Means for Research
